tags: like idk what the sky tower would mean in this case but regardless cat’s reactions to mya are so interesting considering sansa’s arc and
summary: Stone & Snow
body:
Stone & Snow

Since i’m never certain about anything, i’ll say IF jonsa is endgame and grrm has been sitting on this ending for 2 decades….wow he’s good. I recently started rereading the books and I’m almost done AGoT. This is my first time reading since watching the show and reading all the jonsa theories. And when I got to the chapter where Catelyn arrives in the Eyrie I lost it a little.

We have this entire chapter talking about the three towers Stone, Snow, and Sky. And we see Catelyn thinking of Jon when she is lead by the illegitimate Mya Stone, not knowing that one day her own daughter Sansa will become Alayne Stone, of the Vale. There’s so much Stone and Snow imagery in this chapter I was shocked haha. If it’s relevant and we get a union of Stone & Snow, well GRRM has planned his stuff.

blog.description:
If you ship Reylo or Bughead or Harringrove or Jonsa then there’s a 100% I’ll hate you and or think you are disgusting :)

Harvey Kinkle, Jack Kline, Daenerys Targaryen >>>> all other characters

summary: Let me start this off with: I don’t hate Sansa. I know it’s a common thing to hate one of these two female characters and pit...
body:
Try Hard Dany Hate || episode 4

Let me start this off with: I don’t hate Sansa. I know it’s a common thing to hate one of these two female characters and pit them against each other, but I’m one of the few who don’t want to do that and think it would be cool to see them get along. That being said, let’s dive in…

—— Daenerys and Sansa may not be fighting over a man (jesus) but it’s how Jonsa shippers are treating it. They’re lowering both Dany and Sansa to high school girls fighting over the broody but “mysteriously sexy” guy. They have turned it into a ship thing. And putting ships aside, no one has said Sansa wouldn’t be cautious of Dany. I don’t blame her. I would be too. But having them be allies and not enemies isn’t something absurd to desire.

—— “Historic enemies”… uhhh, Starks and Targaryens were allies for centuries. The Starks took Queen Rhaenyra’s side during the Targaryen civil war. These “historic enemies” had an alliance that lasted through so many monarchs and centuries. Yes it ended with Robert’s Rebellion and the Mad King (Rhaegar too, but we learnt that was a lie). But as Dany said, we cannot blame the sins of the father on the child). I don’t see an issue bringing back this historic alliance… this is just ignoring canon. What’s new..

—— “Different political philosophies” let’s talk about their political philosophies.. Sansa wants independence for the North. Okay… Dany wants to break the wheel, and has given the Iron Islands independence already. Instead of just pointing at Dany and thinking the worst; think… if she’s already given independence to the Iron Islands and wants to break the wheel that could lead to two different scenarios:

  • Like the US government; each state (kingdom) will be its own, sort of. Have its own state (kingdom) laws, but still live under the major umbrella of laws and rule (the commander / king-queen). And each state (kingdom) will have a representative.
  • Like the Commonwealth; each country (kingdom) is its own; has its own rules and government, but they’re still under one umbrella of leadership (the monarchy).

Either one of these two would mean independence for each kingdom, but still having rulers on top. As this loosely follows real life politics, this isn’t much of a stretch to think.

—— No one is this Fandom wants Sansa to submit to Dany; to shut up; to braid her hair… no one wants Sansa to become Dany’s servant. You know this, but you chose to try and spin this anyway. The reason why people want them to be allies and not enemies is because They both know how hard it is for a female in their world. They’re both powerful women who have been through Hell.

- - -

This post seems to reek that they want Sansa to back stab Daenerys. As do many other Sansa stans. And I’m not sorry to say that that train of thought is just moronic. Not just politically, but worldly too. Because there are more important things happening, such the army of the dead and the Night King. If they were to betray her there goes her armies and her dragons. There goes the largest helping hand the North has in saving itself from the biggest threat that world will know.

Again… I don’t hate Sansa. I have issues with some of her decisions - like I do with every other character on this show. But I don’t hate her. That’s something I’ve seen from the Dany stans I follow; they don’t hate Sansa. Just Sansa fans, and almost never hate on her. Sansa fans however look for any excuse to hate on Dany. With everything and anything. It’s honestly sad that the Fandom has become this.

Katie. 30. Librarian.

Links to my writing: AO3 FanFiction.net

summary: Tell Me a Story - lilgulie5 - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Tell Me a Story - lilgulie5 - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
body:
Tell Me a Story

Rating: Mature
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
Additional Tags: Fluff, Domestic Fluff, Romance, One Shot, Family, Canon Compliant, Future Fic
Summary: The final installment in the “Are You Awake” trilogy. Jon and Daenerys take turns sharing stories with one another about their pasts. Spans the time from BoatSex through the Battle of the Dawn and beyond.

Excerpt:

“Tell me a story,” she asked, looking at him from the foot of the bed. They were lying at opposite ends as the candles burned low and began to gutter.

“What about this time?” he replied. His fingers trailed along her calf until she pulled it away and crawled towards him. She straddled his waist and pressed her hand over the scar above his heart.”

“I know about these scars,” she said and moved her hand to his face. Her finger traced along the scar around his right eye and then the scar above and below his left eye. “Tell me about these.”

“Well, they’re from different things. The ones here are from an eagle who clawed at my eyes. I used to have one that matched over my right eye but they’re faded more.”

“It’s a wonder you still have your sight.”

“Aye,” he nodded and glanced up at her sheepishly.

“Did you just make a joke?”

“Perhaps.”

“And the other one? This one looks more recent. Another scar from your brothers in the Watch?”

“No. That one is from fighting one of them.”

“Them?” she repeated, the realization not immediately dawning on her, but when it did she was take aback. Her voice was little more than a whisper. “Oh. One of the White Walkers.”

He nodded and lowered his eyes.

“Did he touch you?”

“He threw me around a bit. I fell through a floor. I think that’s when I got it. It’s hard to be sure though. He didn’t touch my bare skin.”

“What…what happens if one of them touches you?”

“I don’t know. I hope I never find out.”

“We’re going to defeat them.”

“I know,” he replied, trying to smile. “You did promise me. I intend to hold you to that promise.”

“I think I’m the one holding you,” she said, placing her hands on his shoulder as she changed the subject.

“You don’t think I couldn’t change that if I wanted to?”

He could. She knew that he could. Although she had told Tyrion that he was too little for her, that was far from the truth. He was strong and could easily lift her if he wanted or needed to.

“Oh you could, but you don’t want to. Do you?”

His fingertips pressed into her hips and for a brief moment she thought he would flip them so she was on her back, but he did not. She smiled and leaned down to kiss him, her hair falling like a curtain around them. Her tongue flicked across his bottom lip before darting into his mouth and sparring with his. She had never made love to anyone who could anticipate her every move the way he did. He was such an eager lover and eager to please her. Over the course of their nights together she learned that he had only been with one other woman, the Wildling he had loved. It was hard to believe and yet not, given his character. In any case, he was the most unselfish lover she had ever known, it made her happy to lavish him with attention.

Read the rest on AO3

(As always, let me know if the link isn’t working. I didn’t redirect it this time so hopefully it’ll be okay!)

He could. She knew that he could. Although she had told Tyrion that he was too little for her, that was far from the truth. He was strong and could easily lift her if he wanted or needed to.

“Oh you could, but you don’t want to. Do you?”

His fingertips pressed into her hips and for a brief moment she thought he would flip them so she was on her back, but he did not. She smiled and leaned down to kiss him, her hair falling like a curtain around them. Her tongue flicked across his bottom lip before darting into his mouth and sparring with his. She had never made love to anyone who could anticipate her every move the way he did. He was such an eager lover and eager to please her. Over the course of their nights together she learned that he had only been with one other woman, the Wildling he had loved. It was hard to believe and yet not, given his character. In any case, he was the most unselfish lover she had ever known, it made her happy to lavish him with attention.

Read the rest on AO3

(As always, let me know if the link isn’t working. I didn’t redirect it this time so hopefully it’ll be okay!)
trail.content:
Tell Me a Story

Rating: Mature
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
Additional Tags: Fluff, Domestic Fluff, Romance, One Shot, Family, Canon Compliant, Future Fic
Summary: The final installment in the “Are You Awake” trilogy. Jon and Daenerys take turns sharing stories with one another about their pasts. Spans the time from BoatSex through the Battle of the Dawn and beyond.

Excerpt:

“Tell me a story,” she asked, looking at him from the foot of the bed. They were lying at opposite ends as the candles burned low and began to gutter.

“What about this time?” he replied. His fingers trailed along her calf until she pulled it away and crawled towards him. She straddled his waist and pressed her hand over the scar above his heart.”

“I know about these scars,” she said and moved her hand to his face. Her finger traced along the scar around his right eye and then the scar above and below his left eye. “Tell me about these.”

“Well, they’re from different things. The ones here are from an eagle who clawed at my eyes. I used to have one that matched over my right eye but they’re faded more.”

“It’s a wonder you still have your sight.”

“Aye,” he nodded and glanced up at her sheepishly.

“Did you just make a joke?”

“Perhaps.”

“And the other one? This one looks more recent. Another scar from your brothers in the Watch?”

“No. That one is from fighting one of them.”

“Them?” she repeated, the realization not immediately dawning on her, but when it did she was take aback. Her voice was little more than a whisper. “Oh. One of the White Walkers.”

He nodded and lowered his eyes.

“Did he touch you?”

“He threw me around a bit. I fell through a floor. I think that’s when I got it. It’s hard to be sure though. He didn’t touch my bare skin.”

“What…what happens if one of them touches you?”

“I don’t know. I hope I never find out.”

“We’re going to defeat them.”

“I know,” he replied, trying to smile. “You did promise me. I intend to hold you to that promise.”

“I think I’m the one holding you,” she said, placing her hands on his shoulder as she changed the subject.

“You don’t think I couldn’t change that if I wanted to?”

He could. She knew that he could. Although she had told Tyrion that he was too little for her, that was far from the truth. He was strong and could easily lift her if he wanted or needed to.

“Oh you could, but you don’t want to. Do you?”

His fingertips pressed into her hips and for a brief moment she thought he would flip them so she was on her back, but he did not. She smiled and leaned down to kiss him, her hair falling like a curtain around them. Her tongue flicked across his bottom lip before darting into his mouth and sparring with his. She had never made love to anyone who could anticipate her every move the way he did. He was such an eager lover and eager to please her. Over the course of their nights together she learned that he had only been with one other woman, the Wildling he had loved. It was hard to believe and yet not, given his character. In any case, he was the most unselfish lover she had ever known, it made her happy to lavish him with attention.

Read the rest on AO3

(As always, let me know if the link isn’t working. I didn’t redirect it this time so hopefully it’ll be okay!)

summary: Hi I love your fiction writing, I would like your thoughts on this: I’m bothered that because Jon butt in with “aha...
question: Hi I love your fiction writing, I would like your thoughts on this: I’m bothered that because Jon butt in with “aha ...everything before the word but” we didn’t get to hear what Sansa was going to say. I would like to hear it was some more sense, “they respect you they really do but you need to discuss things before you announce them out loud”?! Or “but, you need to linger a bit longer on your forehead kisses because it wasn’t really long enough #firsttimeifeltsafeinyears” thanks!
answer:
From their interactions in s6, it’s clear he’s told her about what happened to him, why he was murdered, that he’s been resurrected etc. So, I think that was running through her mind. 

When Sansa suggests that the castles should go to new families, loyal families, the gathered lords and ladies agree. She’s not delivering some odd, controversial solution no one’s ever heard of but instead bringing some sense to the table after Royce’s emotional, “Their castles should be torn down with not a stone left standing!”

Jon’s suggestion, however, is controversial. This is not how things usually are done. Even as Jon and Sansa each argue their point, people still agree with her. The castles should go to new families, families of the men who died fighting for Jon. When Jon states that he’s made his decision and his decision is final, no one murmurs or bangs their cups in the table in agreement. At least not until Ned Umber and Alys Karstark swear fealty.

To my modern ears, Jon’s suggestion is better and kinder, but I still understand Sansa’s worry here. Jon has been named king even though he’s a bastard. She knows how quickly loyalties can shift. She knows what happened the last time Jon made a controversial and modern “yesterday’s wars don’t matter anymore and everyone needs to band together” type of decision. He was murdered for it and she doesn’t want that to happen again because she loves him.

So I think she was only about to remind him of how easy it is to lose respect when you make too many unpopular decisions. Which of course also foreshadowed what happened later, when they were unhappy with Jon’s long stay at DS and the lords started wondering whether they should’ve named Sansa queen instead. And it gives us a hint as to how they’ll react when they learn about Jon bending the knee.

Thanks for the ask!

Ghost will feel her darkness and warning Jon

Animals have instinct, they’re judging you, especially a beast like Ghost, always protecting his master.

If we see this in the 1st episode, we will know, for sure.

summary: I’m having this feeling that Bran is going to be the person to control Rhaegal next season. Everybody is acting like he won’t...
question: I’m having this feeling that Bran is going to be the person to control Rhaegal next season. Everybody is acting like he won’t have a huge role to play in the great war, but I think that will be it. Everyone is saying Jon is going to ride Rhaegal, but it just isn’t realistic to me in 6 episodes, I dunno.
answer:
Hello anon,

I’ll be honest, I don’t subscribe to the theory that Jon will ride a dragon (at least not on the show). They’ve showcased too much is prowess as a fighter and I can’t see them giving that up. It’s more likely than not that he’ll command the ground troops while Dany is up in the air. 

As for skinchanging a dragon, the only dragon I can see being skinschanged is Viserion. I don’t think that a dragon that’s alive can be skinchange. There’s never been any evidence that it’s possible and also because of the phrase Dany uses, “A dragon is not a slave” and skinchanging is a sort of enslavement. 

Warging is different because you are bonded to the wolf, usually, and so I see it more as a symbiotic union rather than a taking over the way skinchanging seems to be.  

I don’t have any strong feeling about how things might play out so I am interested in seeing how the show handles all this. 

TTFN

summary: So at my job people didn’t realize that the Game of Thrones trailer from the crypts is a made up scene. People thought it was...
body:
So at my job people didn’t realize that the Game of Thrones trailer from the crypts is a made up scene. People thought it was something that was definitely going to happen next season and I’m confused. I thought it was super obvious that wasn’t a real scene they took from next season. It similar to the the throne trailer they made for last season.


I’ve become the in-house game of thrones expert and it’s weird cause we’re a magazine and that should have been more obvious to people but I guess not.
